repository.orgName: Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary: This manuscript is of Sāmaveda and perticularly of Rāṇāyanīya śākhā. The singing style is according to the Gautama school. The mantras are written with the vikāras. The manuscript does not contain accent marks. After the guard folio on (3r) some incomplete unidentified Sanskrit text is written in the Granth script. Similaly at the end (recto of the 2nd balnk folio) before the guard folio some incomplete unidentified text is written in the Granth script.

extent.measure: 2 guard folios, 4 blacnk folios after the guard folios at the beginning and 3 at the end. 185 unnumbered folios.

supportDesc.condition: Over all good in condition. Some folios are turned brownish due to patches. Some are not readble due to black patches on the folio.

handNote.desc: readable handwriting. anusvāra over the syllable instead of after it on the writing line.

additions.desc: hariḥ om in the left margin on folio [1v].
Number 22 is written with pink pencil on the front guard folio.

binding.p: Thick palm leaves are used for cover. Five blank palm leaves after hard cover at the beginning. 3 folios at the end before the hard cover.

encodingDesc.p: Folio numbers are supplied. on 185r [tā] letter is doubful.

TEI.text:
[1r 1]gautamasya parkaḥ om agnā i āṃ ho yā hi to yā i to yā ye i nā i ho yā ve i gṛṇāno havyā vo dā no yā [1r 2] vye i | nā ī i hoṃ tā sā
[185r 8]ce[tā]siṃ gna āhavye dā yo (half of the line not legible due to fungus.)
